intro: Phymatodes hastata, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant has a deep taproot system that allows it to survive in dry, sandy soils. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The showy yellow flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
